title: Man Utd get greenlight to secure record - breaking transfer after PSG give way , but Chelsea contact confirmed
body_text:
Manchester United
Premier League • England
Man Utd get greenlight to secure record-breaking transfer after PSG give way, but Chelsea contact confirmed
Man Utd and Chelsea can both complete the signing of a Frenchman who’d break a transfer record this summer, with a report revealing a lucrative sale has been given the greenlight.
The Blues have forked out well in excess of £550m over the last two windows. To help balance the books, a veritable player exodus is on the cards this summer.
However, that won’t stop Chelsea from sanctioning a handful of arrivals. A new centre-forward is wanted and central midfield could also be addressed pending the futures of Conor Gallagher, N’Golo Kante and Mateo Kovacic.
Man Utd, meanwhile, are also seeking additions up front and in the engine room. An attacking upgrade at right-back is also being eyed, with Bayer Leverkusen’s Jeremie Frimpong already engaging in extensive talks over a summer switch.
Now, according to news coming from Germany, Man Utd and Chelsea could soon converge over a player who’ll net his side a new transfer record.
Borussia Monchengladbach’s Kouadio Kone is the player in question, with German outlet BILD claiming a major sale is coming.
Gladbach have suffered losses of around €56m over the last three seasons and hope to raise around €70m through player sales this summer.
Four players have been earmarked for exits, with Kouadio Kone – colloquially known as Manu Kone – the biggest prize. The others are Nico Elvedi, Jordan Beyer and Marvin Friedrich.
Kone, 21, has been tipped as the next Aurelien Tchouameni and operates exclusively in central midfield. However, aside from his defensive prowess he also has blistering pace, sound technical ability and defence-splitting vision in his repertoire too.
Transfer guru Fabrizio Romano recently ran the rule over a potential Kone exit this summer. Speaking on his YouTube channel, Romano listed Chelsea, Man Utd and PSG as showing interest.
“It’s my understanding that three clubs at this moment are leading the race for Manu Kone,” said Romano. “One, for sure, is Chelsea.
“They have many players in their list. We have to include Romeo Lavia, Declan Rice they are always monitoring, but we know Manu Kone is a player they are following. Chelsea will be there.
“Man Utd are following the player too, so Chelsea, United and PSG.”
PSG step aside for Monchengladbach record sale
However, French football expert, Jonathan Johnson, subsequently claimed PSG are unlikely to act on their interest. As such, the race may be down to Man Utd and Chelsea.
On that front, BILD reported Chelsea have made contact with Gladbach, though a move to Old Trafford could hold greater appeal given their likely participation in next year’s Champions League.
On the subject of cost, Kone looks destined to net Gladbach a new club-record transfer fee. That distinction is currently held by Granit Xhaka who was sold to Arsenal for €45m back in 2016.
Romano reported Kone will cost “at least €50m (approx. £44m) with add-ons [on top].”
BILD confirm a Kone deal ‘is expected to break Borussia Monchengladbach’s record for a fee received’.
